00057 #ifndef _FIXED_MEM_POOL_H
00058 #define _FIXED_MEM_POOL_H
00059 
00060 #include <new>
00061 #include <assert.h>
00062 #include <stdlib.h>
00063 #include "class_level_lock.h"
00064 #include "mem_pool_base.h"
00065 #include "static_assert.h"
00066 
00070 #ifndef MEM_POOL_ALIGNMENT
00071 #define MEM_POOL_ALIGNMENT 4
00072 #endif
00073 
00080 template <class _Tp>
00081 class fixed_mem_pool
00082 {
00083 public:
00084     typedef typename class_level_lock<fixed_mem_pool<_Tp> >::lock lock;
00089     struct alignment
00090     {
00091         static const size_t value = MEM_POOL_ALIGNMENT;
00092     };
00097     struct block_size
00098     {
00099         static const size_t value =
00100             (sizeof(_Tp) + fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::alignment::value - 1)
00101                        & ~(fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::alignment::value - 1);
00102     };
00103     static void*  allocate();
00104     static void   deallocate(void*);
00105     static bool   initialize(size_t size);
00106     static int    deinitialize();
00107     static int    get_alloc_count();
00108     static bool   is_initialized();
00109 protected:
00110     static bool   bad_alloc_handler();
00111 private:
00112     static void*  _S_mem_pool_ptr;
00113     static void*  _S_first_avail_ptr;
00114     static int    _S_alloc_cnt;
00115 };
00116 
00118 template <class _Tp>
00119 void* fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::_S_mem_pool_ptr = NULL;
00120 
00122 template <class _Tp>
00123 void* fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::_S_first_avail_ptr = NULL;
00124 
00126 template <class _Tp>
00127 int   fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::_S_alloc_cnt = 0;
00128 
00134 template <class _Tp>
00135 inline void* fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::allocate()
00136 {
00137     lock guard;
00138     for (;;)
00139     {
00140         if (void* result = _S_first_avail_ptr)
00141         {
00142             _S_first_avail_ptr = *(void**)_S_first_avail_ptr;
00143             ++_S_alloc_cnt;
00144             return result;
00145         }
00146         else
00147             if (!bad_alloc_handler())
00148                 return NULL;
00149     }
00150 }
00151 
00157 template <class _Tp>
00158 inline void fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::deallocate(void* block_ptr)
00159 {
00160     if (block_ptr == NULL)
00161         return;
00162     lock guard;
00163     assert(_S_alloc_cnt != 0);
00164     --_S_alloc_cnt;
00165     *(void**)block_ptr = _S_first_avail_ptr;
00166     _S_first_avail_ptr = block_ptr;
00167 }
00168 
00175 template <class _Tp>
00176 bool fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::initialize(size_t size)
00177 {
00178     STATIC_ASSERT(alignment::value > 0 && alignment::value <= 8192,
00179                   Bad_alignment);
00180     STATIC_ASSERT((alignment::value & (alignment::value - 1)) == 0,
00181                   Alignment_must_be_power_of_two);
00182     STATIC_ASSERT(block_size::value >= sizeof(void*),
00183                   Alignment_too_small);
00184     assert(!is_initialized());
00185     assert(size > 0);
00186     _S_mem_pool_ptr = mem_pool_base::alloc_sys(size * block_size::value);
00187     _S_first_avail_ptr = _S_mem_pool_ptr;
00188     if (_S_mem_pool_ptr == NULL)
00189         return false;
00190     char* block = (char*)_S_mem_pool_ptr;
00191     while (--size != 0)
00192     {
00193         char* next = block + block_size::value;
00194         *(void**)block = next;
00195         block = next;
00196     }
00197     *(void**)block = NULL;
00198     return true;
00199 }
00200 
00208 template <class _Tp>
00209 int fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::deinitialize()
00210 {
00211     if (_S_alloc_cnt != 0)
00212         return _S_alloc_cnt;
00213     assert(is_initialized());
00214     mem_pool_base::dealloc_sys(_S_mem_pool_ptr);
00215     _S_mem_pool_ptr = NULL;
00216     _S_first_avail_ptr = NULL;
00217     return 0;
00218 }
00219 
00225 template <class _Tp>
00226 inline int fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::get_alloc_count()
00227 {
00228     return _S_alloc_cnt;
00229 }
00230 
00236 template <class _Tp>
00237 inline bool fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::is_initialized()
00238 {
00239     return _S_mem_pool_ptr != NULL;;
00240 }
00241 
00250 template <class _Tp>
00251 bool fixed_mem_pool<_Tp>::bad_alloc_handler()
00252 {
00253     return false;
00254 }

00266 #define DECLARE_FIXED_MEM_POOL(_Cls) \
00267 public: \
00268     static void* operator new(size_t size) \
00269     { \
00270         assert(size == sizeof(_Cls)); \
00271         if (void* pointer = fixed_mem_pool<_Cls>::allocate()) \
00272             return pointer; \
00273         else \
00274             throw std::bad_alloc(); \
00275     } \
00276     static void  operator delete(void* pointer) \
00277     { \
00278         if (pointer != NULL) \
00279             fixed_mem_pool<_Cls>::deallocate(pointer); \
00280     }
00281 
00288 #define DECLARE_FIXED_MEM_POOL__NOTHROW(_Cls) \
00289 public: \
00290     static void* operator new(size_t size) throw() \
00291     { \
00292         assert(size == sizeof(_Cls)); \
00293         return fixed_mem_pool<_Cls>::allocate(); \
00294     } \
00295     static void  operator delete(void* pointer) \
00296     { \
00297         if (pointer != NULL) \
00298             fixed_mem_pool<_Cls>::deallocate(pointer); \
00299     }

00313 #define DECLARE_FIXED_MEM_POOL__THROW_NOCHECK(_Cls) \
00314 public: \
00315     static void* operator new(size_t size) \
00316     { \
00317         assert(size == sizeof(_Cls)); \
00318         return fixed_mem_pool<_Cls>::allocate(); \
00319     } \

00324     }
